music

Class Note

  • java.lang.Object
    • music.Note

  • public final class Note
extends java.lang.Object
    The class Note represents a note and contains its pitch, duration and accidentals. It's immutable.

    • Field Summary

    • Method Detail

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • getLetter

        public char getLetter()
        Gets the letter corresponding to the pitch of the note, if it represents a white key on the piano. Otherwise, returns an error code.
        Returns:
        the letter (one of 'A' through 'G'), or (char) 0 if the note doesn't represent a white key

      • getLetter

        public static char getLetter(Pitch pitch)
        Gets the letter corresponding to the given pitch, if it represents a white key on the piano. Otherwise, returns an error code.
        Parameters:
        pitch -
        Returns:
        the letter (one of 'A' through 'G'), or (char) 0 if the note doesn't represent a white key

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object

      • multiply

        public Note multiply(int numerator,
            int denominator)
        Multiply the duration of this note by a fraction. Only used for tuplets, so preconditions are that numerator and denominator must be between 1 and 10.
        Parameters:
        numerator - the numerator of the fraction
        denominator - the denominator of the fraction
        Returns:
        a new note with the multiplication applied to it

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
